title: pkg-config won't build on rhel7?
body:
I'm not sure where to go with this one:

spack-build.out
```
==> Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> Executing phase: 'configure'
==> '/scratch/spack.20170913/var/spack/stage/pkg-config-0.29.2-ovuu7curwnaicby3lgtvruypuaiwagrf/pkg-config-0.29.2/configure' '--prefix=/scratch/spack.20170913/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/pkg-config-0.29.2-ovuu7curwnaicby3lgtvruypuaiwagrf' '--enable-shared' '--with-internal-glib'
checking for a BSD-compatible install... /bin/install -c
checking whether build environment is sane... yes
checking for a thread-safe mkdir -p... /bin/mkdir -p
checking for gawk... gawk
checking whether make sets $(MAKE)... yes
checking whether make supports nested variables... yes
configure: error: source directory already configured; run "make distclean" there first
```

Anyone else seeing this?  Should I update the recipe for pkg-config? or is there something wrong with AutotoolsPackage?
